source.title: A critical role for the right fronto-insular cortex in switching between central-executive and default-mode networks

confidence_rationale: Strong network-switching evidence supports mode-transition control routing, though it does not directly specify REE stream contracts.

mapping.source_claim_statement: The right fronto-insular region is implicated in switching between default-mode and central-executive network states.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports ARC-016 framing that cognitive modes can be treated as control-plane regime transitions over shared predictive machinery.
mapping.mapping_caveat: fMRI network-switching evidence is correlational-dominant and does not by itself define mechanistic stream-level routing policies.
mapping.source_context: Human fMRI network-dynamics analysis during cognitive switching tasks.

confidence_components.notes: Directly relevant to salience-mediated network regime switching.
